answers.answer: As long as your drinking enough water that you are not dehydrated you should be fine. I usually drink about 3 bottles a day and a gaterade, sometimes more, sometimes less. It all just depends on your body, there isn't a set number that you should drink. But as long as your peeing and it isn't orange, your not dehydrated and that amount of water is enough for you!

Gatorade is a good alternative to water if you aren't a gestational diabetic. If you can't stand how boring water is try those flavor drops or the tea things in a bottle or add cucumbers and lemon for flavors

Yes that is true you need to drink a lot of water & as your pregnancy progresses you need to drink even more because the water you drink makes up your babies amniotic fluid . Make an effort & drink atleast another bottle a day , everyday. So 3 bottles .Try ice cold water . It's my favorite , I can't drink it if it's not cold , that's why I recommend really cold water.I drink like 7 bottles a day lol I know it's a lot my dr says it's fine that's why my amniotic fluid is awesome so far .
I was the same way not drinking enough water...I used to be addicted to soda before I got pregnant so trying to adjust to anything else was hard for me all I drink now is water

To be honest im in my third trimester and my babys amniotic fluid is low n friday I have to go get hooked up to the machine to make sure she is ok I didnt think that not drinking water would be that big of a deal but it is and now im trying to drink as much water as I can
I didnt like to drink water as much and ended up having preeclampsia .. you should drink more
You should drink more water. I didnt at first and my babys heart beat was high so was sent to the hospital. now I drink at least a gallon of water and my baby is fine and moving a lot.

Yes they would like for you to drink water but everything else is also good to drink too. As long asyour ddrinking close to a gallon of liquids than you are fine. I was having headaches really bad every time I stood up and it was because I wasn't drinking enough fluids, so that's when my doctor told me a gallon is what I should be drinking or around that much at least

I'm the same way I cannot drink water very good. And I've always had bad luck with it. I'd have to have IVs and be very dehydrated. So I started eating cups and cups of either cubed or crushed ice (crushed is easier) and pretty soon eating the ice and drinking the water as well everyday helped me keep hydrated :)
